intro: Cuphea scolnikiae, commonly known as the red flame cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its vibrant color and compact growth habit. Cuphea scolnikiae is relatively drought-tolerant and prefers well-drained soil.
